alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 4:25AM CDT until June 03 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Crosby, southern Floyd, southern Hale and Lubbock Counties. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in urban areas and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 2 inches are expected over the area, with the heaviest amounts most likely to affect areas from northern Lubbock County to southeast Floyd County. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Slaton, Floydada, Abernathy, Crosbyton, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ralls, Petersburg, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, Lubbock International Airport, Cone, Downtown Lubbock, Texas Tech University, Woodrow, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide and Reese Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
